eyeColors.eyeColorContent: Your eye color is brown. Here are some details about brown eyes...
eyeColors.goal: Bring out the richness and versatility of brown eyes.

recommendedColors.description: Gold, bronze, and rich burgundy add warmth and dimension.
Purples like plum and violet create a striking contrast.
Copper, bronze, and emerald green for bold looks.
They may blend too much with the natural eye color.

techniques: Create a smokey eye using rich purple or green tones.
Use a metallic gold or bronze shade on the lid with a darker brown in the crease.
For eyeliner, experiment with emerald green or deep purple for a unique touch.

eyeColors.eyeColorContent: Your eye color is blue. Here are some details about blue eyes...
eyeColors.goal: Enhance the vividness and contrast of blue tones.

recommendedColors.description: Copper, bronze, peach, and terracotta create contrast and make blue eyes pop.
Soft taupe or beige for a subtle look.
Navy blue or slate grey for a dramatic effect
They may clash with the natural eye color

techniques: Use a bronze or gold shimmer on the lid with a darker brown shade in the crease.
Highlight the inner corner with champagne or light gold for brightness.
Line the eyes with brown or copper eyeliner to enhance depth.

eyeColors.eyeColorContent: Your eye color is green. Here are some details about green eyes...
eyeColors.goal: Enhance the rare green hue with complementary shades.

recommendedColors.description: Copper, rust, and warm browns emphasize the green.
Lavender, plum, and mauve add depth and contrast.
Gold and bronze for an elegant look.
Greens that closely match your eye color, as they may reduce contrast

techniques: Apply a copper or bronze shade across the lid and blend with a warm brown in the crease.
Use a light gold shimmer in the inner corner and under the brow bone for a lifted effect.
Line the eyes with plum or aubergine eyeliner for a soft, enhancing touch.

eyeColors.eyeColorContent: Your eye color is grey. Here are some details about grey eyes...
eyeColors.goal: Amplify the soft, mysterious quality of grey eyes.

recommendedColors.description: Peach, pink, and rose gold add warmth and contrast.
Charcoal, navy, and silver for a dramatic effect.
Silver and gunmetal accentuate the natural coolness of grey.
They may dull the eye color.

techniques: Use a soft peach or rose shade on the lid with a charcoal grey in the outer corner for definition.
Add silver shimmer to the center of the lid for a reflective effect.
Line the eyes with black or dark grey eyeliner to enhance intensity.
